description:
Overview

Our team understands that time is scarce, so we are intentional about putting ourselves in the shoes of those we serve. The result is a unique combination of talented people and industry-leading technology that enables SP+, a Metropolis Company, to prioritize each and every moment, recognizing that the time colleagues, clients and customers invest in us must always matter.

We invite you to join the industry leader in parking and technology as we seek an accomplished and inspiring leader with multi-location experience to serve as a Vice President, Operations to oversee our commercial portfolio in Southern California. Reporting to the SVP, Operations (West), you will play a pivotal role in shaping and executing the Commercial Division’s strategic vision for Metropolis’ parking and transportation operations services and technology driven mobility solutions for Southern California.

What We Offer

  • Health Insurance, Vision, and Dental
  • Participation in the Company's performance based bonus structure
  • Participation in bonus program
  • 401(K) Match Program with immediate match
  • Short-Term and Long-Term Life Disability
  • Life Insurance
  • Paid time off, including vacation, mental health, sick and holidays
  • Fantastic opportunities for career growth
  • A knowledgeable, high-achieving, experienced team
  • Learning opportunities through our internal training program, SP+ University
  • A diverse company that cares about inclusion, innovation and the environment. Visit www.spplus.com to learn more
  • A free and confidential employee assistance program (EAP) that provides support and resources to employees and their families 24/7

Responsibilities

 What you’ll do

Financial Leadership:

  • Spearhead the development and execution of strategic plans, budgets, and financial forecasts for parking operations.
  • Monitor and optimize financial and operational performance across multiple locations to ensure profitability.
  • Implement proactive measures to address budget discrepancies and recommend strategies for revenue maximization.
  • Manage the P&L for a portfolio of more than 300 locations in Southern California with approximately $190 MM GPV.

Business Development:

  • Drive the development of new business opportunities for our best-in-class operations management services and suite of Metropolis technology solutions, while optimizing profitability in existing operations.
  • Lead end-to-end business development processes, from account planning to successful client onboarding.
  • Maintain a strategic balance in the operating/marketing split to achieve optimal growth.

Client Relationship Management:

  • Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with clients, ensuring ongoing satisfaction and understanding of operational and budgetary aspects.
  • Lead negotiations and agreements with new clients, expanding the breadth and depth of business relationships.

Talent Development:

  • Champion the development of a high-performing team, creating and executing individualized development plans.
  • Provide mentorship to team members and take corrective actions when performance falls below expectations.
  • Foster an inclusive environment that supports the advancement and development of diverse talent.

Qualifications

 What you need

  • 10+ years of experience overseeing multiple regions or a large geographic area in the parking industry
  • 5+ years overseeing efforts of high-level managers and directors to achieve strategic objectives.
  • Previous experience in strategic planning, decision-making, and successful execution of initiatives in collaboration with executive leadership.
  • Strong leadership skills with a focus on fostering collaboration and achieving results through a team of seasoned leaders.
  • Demonstrated ability to influence senior stakeholders and align teams with overarching business goals.
  • Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, enabling effective engagement with a diverse group of senior leaders within the organization.
  • Proven ability to create and maintain a positive team culture that encourages professional growth and high performance.
  • Proven track record of successfully meeting/exceeding budget expectations, development of new business and developing strong client relationships
  • Other key competencies include: financial analysis skills, familiarity with contract structures and required terms; presentation skills; negotiation skills; and strong verbal/written communication skills
  • Computer skills: Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel and PowerPoint); Prior experience with budgeting software, Salesforce, P&L Review systems preferred
  • Bachelor's Degree in a relevant field; advanced degree or equivalent experience preferred
  • License Requirement : Must possess a valid state-issued driver’s license with a current address and acceptable driving record

Salary Range: $225,000 - $255,000 per year

Benefits: Eligible employees will participate in the various benefits plans including medical, dental, vision, flexible spending accounts, long/short term disability, life insurance, accident insurance, 401k and paid time off.

SP+ is an equal opportunity employer committed in policy and practice to recruit, hire, train, and promote, in all job classifications, without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity, disability or other classes protected by federal or state law. SP+ does not tolerate harassment or retaliation against any employee or applicant based on these characteristics or because the individual exercised their EEO rights.

Location

US-CA-LOS ANGELES
